sub_title: Researching people & technology at ASCoR | Co-founder of Sarg | UCL | University of Groningen
summary:
I am an innovator with a passion for improving the quality of and accessibility to mental health services through technological solutions. 

Currently, I am a PhD candidate at the Amsterdam School of Communication Research (ASCoR) at the University of Amsterdam. My research currently focuses on social robotics and expanding the theoretical framework underlying human-robot communication, and understanding communication in general. 

I am also the founder of The Sarg Initiative, an early stage social startup aimed towards improving mental health literacy in the educational ecosystem in India. We are currently seeking out educational institutions to be our first users!

I completed my BSc (Hons) in Psychology from University College London in 2019. My undergraduate dissertation about the differences between interpersonal trust and trust in artificial intelligence was awarded the PsyPAG Undergraduate Award. Subsequently, I graduated with MSc in Human-Machine Communication from the University of Groningen in 2021. During my Master's degree, I was a visiting research student at Cornell Tech, Cornell University. I also completed an internship at the Human Factors group in TNO, Netherlands. 

During my time at UCL, I was involved in various student activities. I was the founder and president of a student research network known as UCL Connect.ed. During the pandemic, my cofounder and I are brought the core missions and vision of Connect.ed to life outside UCL and on a global scale. The CABLE Project played an important role in allowing university students to build their professional networks in an increasingly remote world.

In 2019, I was selected to be a part of the University of Groningen Honours Master's Leadership cohort, which allows a selected group of students with an aptitude for leadership to further develop their skills. I also brought Hult Prize to the University of Groningen and led the first-ever OnCampus Program. Additionally, I have also worked for UN SDSN Youth as a Project Officer for the Investment Readiness Program. 

Outside of my work and education, I am an avid reader, photographer, and traveller! If you see something interesting here, feel free to drop me a message. I am always open to new collaborations and enthusiastic discussions.

awards.title: PsyPAG 2019 Undergraduate Award
awards.description:
The PsyPAG Awards acknowledge and celebrate some of the most exceptional research. The PsyPAG Undergraduate Award recognises outstanding research in an undergraduate research dissertation from all areas of Psychology across the UK. 

The winning project was an explorative research related to the influence of individual differences on trust in humans versus artificial intelligence. 

Read more here: http://www.psypag.co.uk/award-winners/

awards.title: Santander Universities Mobility Bursary
awards.description: Recipient of the study abroad bursary to pursue a summer program at the University of Chicago. https://www.ucl.ac.uk/studyabroad/options/other_opportunities/funding_accordian/santander_universities_mobility_bursary_information_sheet

awards.title: Short Mobility Bursary Award
awards.description: Bursary to pursue the Global Summer Program at the Singapore Management University.

projects.title: Hatch 2018
projects.description: A 2-day innovation hackathon hosted by SheCanCode and UCL Entrepreneurs at Ministry of Justice HQ, London, leveraging diversity and technology to address the UN SDGs and create real world social impact. Teams were assigned different SDGs and had 36 hours to design a technological solution to address a specific problem in line with that SDG.

contributors.headline: Researching people & technology at ASCoR | Co-founder of Sarg | UCL | University of Groningen

projects.title: Nudgeathon 2017
projects.description: A competition held by Warwick Business School in which teams used insights from behavioural sciences to develop ideas to reduce energy consumption. Teams were given a crash course in ‘nudging’, which uses theories from behavioural science to develop subtle interventions to persuade people to behave how they would like them to behave. They then had 24 hours to develop a solution to nudging people to change the way they use energy in their homes.

contributors.headline: Researching people & technology at ASCoR | Co-founder of Sarg | UCL | University of Groningen

projects.title: Youth Design Innovation Challenge
projects.description:
First prize winners in the Youth Design Innovation Challenge 2018

Red Dot Foundation along with Developmatrix, The Urban Vision, Tata Capital, the US Consulate General, Mumbai and the School Leaders Network Foundation is hosting a social incubator called the Youth Design Innovation Challenge. Eleven ideas solving gender equality issues caused due to rapid urbanization were shortlisted for the final challenge.

contributors.headline: Researching people & technology at ASCoR | Co-founder of Sarg | UCL | University of Groningen

projects.title: UCL Global Citizenship Program - Social Startup
projects.description: We created a social business to address the problem of malnutrition among children in underprivileged communities of London. The key operation of the business would be supplying healthy smoothies to offices in London and for every smoothie order placed, the business would match and deliver it to a school in an underprivileged neighbourhood in London.

contributors.headline: Researching people & technology at ASCoR | Co-founder of Sarg | UCL | University of Groningen

projects.title: UCL ChangeMakers (Behavioural Analytics)
projects.description: ChangeMakers is a program at UCL in which student-run projects that improve education are funded by the university. I worked as the treasurer on a project that developed a new module in the BSc Psychology program. This is an interdisciplinary module jointly run by the Psychology and Computer Science departments. It is called Machine Learning for Behavioural Analytics. I managed the budget and was one of the primary points of contact for the ChangeMakers team.

contributors.headline: Researching people & technology at ASCoR | Co-founder of Sarg | UCL | University of Groningen

projects.title: UCL Global Citizenship Program - (Un)Urban: Designing for the Green City (Human Wellbeing)
projects.description: We received training in human-centered design. Subsequently, we used the human-centered design process to improve community engagement in an industrial area (Cody Docks) in east London.

profile_positions.description:
The CABLE Project (previously Connect.ed Global) started as a spin-off to a successful initiative (Connect.ed Society) Yu Zon and I started at UCL. The aim of this was to expand our flagship Research Mentorship Programme beyond university grounds and to serve students in a global space.

CABLE is a voluntary, not-for-profit initiative that connects undergraduates with postgraduates through a fully facilitated mentorship programme. We ran several highly successful cohorts of our Research Mentorship Programme between 2021 and 2022. Additionally, we organised and co-organized a variety of research-oriented events. 

In my role as co-founder and Head of Operations, I oversaw the execution of the Research Mentorship Programme. I was also involved in shaping and leading the overarching vision and organisational strategy.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description: The aim of this internship was to understand the factors that influence social presence in mediated communication and validate, through user studies, a questionnaire that quantifies holistic experience in mediated communication. This research was conducted under the supervision of Dr Alexander Toet. The findings of this research internship were presented at IHIET 2021 (August) and IHIET 2022 (April), and have been published in the conference proceedings.
profile_positions.title: Intern (Human Factors)

profile_positions.company: UN Sustainable Development Solutions Network – Youth
profile_positions.description:
Implemented and oversaw the fourth edition of the Youth Solutions Team's flagship Investment Readiness Program. 

The Investment Readiness Program (IRP) is a 16-week acceleration program hosted in collaboration with Babele.co. The program provides innovators featured in the Youth Solutions Report with insights from leading experts in the field, personalised one-on-one mentoring, and the opportunity to connect with impact investors. Each week, participants attend online webinars and build their investment proposition. They receive personalised feedback from mentors and experts in the field.
profile_positions.title: Project Officer - Investment Readiness Program

profile_positions.description: Established and ran the first-ever Hult Prize OnCampus Program at the University of Groningen. The OnCampus Program allows students to bypass the global entry round and head straight to the Regional Summits of the Hult Prize Competition. In addition to a final university-wide competition, our OnCampus Program also included training sessions (e.g. developing a business model, pitching, marketing, etc.), networking events, ideation events, talks from student entrepreneurs, and other events.
profile_positions.title: Campus Director

profile_positions.description: The Global Citizenship Program is a two-week long summer school. As a navigator on the Outbreak strand, among other organisational responsibilities, I conducted workshops in the first week related to global health, epidemiology, digital public health, etc. and managed the WHO simulation in the second week along with fellow navigators. For the simulation, I was the vice-chair for the SEARO/WPRO region.
profile_positions.title: Navigator

profile_positions.description:
UCL connect.ed is a student initiative to build a research community for students. Connect.ed promotes interdisciplinary research and facilitates interaction between student researchers to make acquiring research skills simpler and more accessible.

In October 2018, UCL connect.ed was founded and our flagship Research Mentorship Program was launched. In November 2018, 12 mentors and 18 mentees were recruited for the first cycle of the program. In March 2019, Connect.ed Society was established through successful affiliation with Students' Union UCL. 

We were also invited to present our work with Connect.ed at the UCL Education Conference in April 2019. Finally, Connect.ed was shortlisted for the Best Academic Achievement by the UCL Awards Committee in May 2019.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description: Attending to the visitors at the Students' Union, guiding and providing them with any requested information. Facilitating communication between external parties wishing to contact those working at the Student's Union. Completing administrative tasks.
profile_positions.title: Front Desk Receptionist

profile_positions.description:
I have assisted on a project and completed two independent research projects under the supervision of a lecturer at the UCL Department of Information Studies (formerly at UCL Interaction Centre). 

I assisted with the data analysis and report writing of CyberGate, a research carried out originally at EdgeHill University, UK. The research investigated the effectiveness of gameplay on learning with students studying cybersecurity. I learnt about the challenges related to data collection and analysis in naturalistic settings. I further improved my report writing skills. My learnings from this project effectively supplemented my degree studies. 

I also completed an independent research related to navigation instructions and the influence of personality. This research studied the how different navigation instructions interact with one's innate personality to influence navigation performance and route memory. Broader implications associated with the use of navigation technologies were noted. 

Most recently, I worked on a research investigating the difference between trust in humans and in artificial intelligence technologies. The effect of individual differences on trust was explored. I am currently attempting to publish all projects.
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Researcher

volunteer_experiences.description: As a Hey Team volunteer, I was involved with helping ease new students into their new surroundings and welcoming them into the UCL family. The Hey Team was based around the main UCL campus, from the week before term starts to meet and greet new students, answer their queries and promote social events and opportunities.
Provided information and support to OCD affected individuals and their families, friends, and caregivers.
Organised events and designed publicity materials to promote Nightline at UCL.
Assisted psychologists supporting children with learning disabilities from poor socio-economic backgrounds.
Worked with underprivileged teenagers to develop spoken English skills. Designed curriculums and planned lessons to improve learning.
